intro: Angianthus micropodioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved angianthus, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
